About Me

Here's a few things about me...

BIO

Hello!

My name is Mike, and I'm a Software Engineer with a passion for working with people and technology. I'm always looking forward to being apart of meaningful projects.

I try to code as often as possible, and I enjoy collaborating with different people around the world. My strongest language at this time is Python, but I also enjoy working with JavaScript. I think Django and React are pretty swell too.

Some of my other unique hobbies include learning human languages, finance, and the universal everlasting logical language of math.

Software Engineering Coach

Software Tutor

  • Reviewing code and other technologies with students including but not limited to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Redux, Python, and Django
  • Assisting instructional staff with evaluating the educational progress of students
  • Grading assignments and providing feedback for students and facilitators
  • Meeting with students regularly to reinforce learning and assist in understanding assignments

Technical Skills

Full Stack Developer

  • Languages
    - JavaScript, CSS, Sass, HTML, NoSQL, SQL, Python, Java
  • Libraries & Frameworks
    - React, Redux, Django, Vue.js, Node.js, Express.js, Next.js
  • Skills
    - Responsive Web Design, Agile, Accessibility, Localization, Leadership
  • Web Technologies
    - REST, JSON, Non-Relational Databases, Relational Databases
  • Tools
    - VSCode, Git, PyCharm, IntelliJ IDEA, ESLint, Postman, Babel

Software Engineering Facilitator

Software Educator

  • Coordinating groups of 30+ students as they learn software engineering
  • Providing regular demonstrations on how to use programming languages and technologies associated with full-stack web development
  • Working with instructional staff and upper management to create and adapt curriculum to better reinforce student engagement with learning material
  • Grading assignments and providing feedback for students, facilitators, and other instructional staff
